inlineContent.text: objects when the user asks to see sent or received messages. You must implement this intent to support the reading of messages by Siri. This intent object contains the values for you to match when searching the userâ€™s messages. Users can search for messages involving a specific person, messages with specific sent or received dates, or messages containing specific terms. When performing the search, use only the provided parameters, and ignore any that have no values.
To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the
protocol. Your handler confirms the request and creates an
object with the results of the search. For successful searches, Siri offers the user a way to launch your app and see the results.
To implement support for this intent fully, you must also implement support for the

class. After reading messages that your search returns, Siri marks them as read by modifying the attributes of the messages using that intent class. For more information about supporting the set message attribute intent, see

abstract.text: The ability for Siri to automatically read out messages over AirPods.
An option that grants Siri permission to read incoming messages out loud when the user has a compatible audio output device connected.

abstract.text: A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
